body:
Bumps [futures](https://github.com/rust-lang/futures-rs) from 0.3.14 to 0.3.15.
Release notes

Sourced from futures's releases.

0.3.15

  • Use #[proc_macro] at Rust 1.45+ to fix an issue where proc macros don't work with rust-analyzer (#2407)
  • Support targets that do not have atomic CAS on stable Rust (#2400)
  • futures-test: Add async #[test] function attribute (#2409)
  • Add stream::abortable (#2410)
  • Add FuturesUnordered::clear (#2415)
  • Implement IntoIterator for FuturesUnordered (#2423)
  • Implement Send and Sync for FuturesUnordered iterators (#2416)
  • Make FuturesUnordered::iter_pin_ref public (#2423)
  • Add SelectAll::clear (#2430)
  • Add SelectAll::{iter, iter_mut} (#2428)
  • Implement IntoIterator for SelectAll (#2428)
  • Implement Clone for WeakShared (#2396)
Changelog

Sourced from futures's changelog.

0.3.15 - 2021-05-11

  • Use #[proc_macro] at Rust 1.45+ to fix an issue where proc macros don't work with rust-analyzer (#2407)
  • Support targets that do not have atomic CAS on stable Rust (#2400)
  • futures-test: Add async #[test] function attribute (#2409)
  • Add stream::abortable (#2410)
  • Add FuturesUnordered::clear (#2415)
  • Implement IntoIterator for FuturesUnordered (#2423)
  • Implement Send and Sync for FuturesUnordered iterators (#2416)
  • Make FuturesUnordered::iter_pin_ref public (#2423)
  • Add SelectAll::clear (#2430)
  • Add SelectAll::{iter, iter_mut} (#2428)
  • Implement IntoIterator for SelectAll (#2428)
  • Implement Clone for WeakShared (#2396)
Commits
  • fc080d1 Release 0.3.15 (#2436)
  • 3d3b664 Remove extra text from test attribute docs (#2435)
  • 5954cff futures-macro: improve diagnostics on type mismatch (#2433)
  • 56bc87e Change SelectAll iterators to return stream instead of StreamFuture (#2431)
  • 579b98b Add SelectAll::clear (#2430)
  • d663bc1 expose iterators from SelectAll (#2428)
  • 37d15b7 Abortable streams (#2410)
  • 5912e2e Add FuturesUnordered::clear (#2415)
  • 48d65c3 add FuturesUnordered::into_iter, make iter_pin_ref public (#2423)
  • aa39d14 Rename Take::limit_ field to limit
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: github_actions

body:
Bumps [gaurav-nelson/github-action-markdown-link-check](https://github.com/gaurav-nelson/github-action-markdown-link-check) from 1 to 1.0.12.
Release notes

Sourced from gaurav-nelson/github-action-markdown-link-check's releases.

1.0.12

Updated to Markdown link check v 3.8.6

  • Supports updated replacementPatterns and new projectBaseUrl parameters. PS: https://github.com/tcort/markdown-link-check#markdownlinkcheckmarkdown-opts-callback
    • replacementPatterns an array of objects holding regular expressions which are replaced in a link with their corresponding replacement string. This behavior allows (for example) to adapt to certain platform conventions hosting the Markdown. The special replacement {{BASEURL}} can be used to dynamically link to the base folder (used from projectBaseUrl) (for example that / points to the root of your local repository). Example: [{ pattern: /^.attachments/, replacement: "file://some/conventional/folder/.attachments" }, { pattern: ^/, replacement: "{{BASEURL}}/"}]
    • projectBaseUrl the URL to use for {{BASEURL}} replacement

1.0.11

  • Fixed file path issue.

1.0.10

  • Fixes broken link check for multiple folders #87

1.0.9

  • Updated to markdown-link-check@3.8.5 to fix #84 False positive error raised (because of link-check@4.5.3 dependency of markdown-link-check)

1.0.8

  • Updated markdown-link-check to version 3.8.3 (latest)

1.0.7

Fixed #69 Link check fails for deleted markdown files, updated the logic to get only added or modified files.

1.0.6

  • Fixed #41 The action now supports configuring multiple files and directories. PS: https://github.com/gaurav-nelson/github-action-markdown-link-check#check-multiple-directories-and-files
  • Fixed #52 The action now fails with an error if you configure a non-existent folder of file.

1.0.5

Fixes for:

  • #63 File Extension test doesn't match with default on check-modified-files-only
  • #48 check-modified-files-only filtering files incorrectly

1.0.4

Fixes for false positives #50

1.0.3

  • Fixed #40 #45 Enabling quiet-mode option caused false positives and reported incorrect file names.
  • Fixed #43 Enabling check-modified-files-only option wasn't working with file-extension option.

1.0.2

  • [x] Added file-extension variable for supporting markdown files with different extensions. (Issue #35 )
  • [x] Filtered the log output for quiet option, it now only shows filenames and failed links for those files.

1.0.1

  • [x] Added check-modified-files-only variable to check modified files only. (Issue #23 )

body:
Bumps [reqwest](https://github.com/seanmonstar/reqwest) from 0.11.1 to 0.11.2.
Release notes

Sourced from reqwest's releases.

v0.11.2

  • Add CookieStore trait to customize the type that stores and retrieves cookies for a session.
  • Add cookie::Jar as a default CookieStore, easing creating some session cookies before creating the Client.
  • Add ClientBuilder::http2_adaptive_window() option to configure an adaptive HTTP2 flow control behavior.
  • Add ClientBuilder::http2_max_frame_size() option to adjust the maximum HTTP2 frame size that can be received.
  • Implement IntoUrl for String, making it more convenient to create requests with format!.
Changelog

Sourced from reqwest's changelog.

v0.11.2

  • Add CookieStore trait to customize the type that stores and retrieves cookies for a session.
  • Add cookie::Jar as a default CookieStore, easing creating some session cookies before creating the Client.
  • Add ClientBuilder::http2_adaptive_window() option to configure an adaptive HTTP2 flow control behavior.
  • Add ClientBuilder::http2_max_frame_size() option to adjust the maximum HTTP2 frame size that can be received.
  • Implement IntoUrl for String, making it more convenient to create requests with format!.

title: Add libp2p identify + ping behaviour
body:
Pings peers at interval to monitor if they are still reachable. Could eventually use the round-trip time for latency based node selection. Identify allows dynamic addresses discovery between two nodes. 

Closes #297

title: chore(deps): bump serde_yaml from 0.8.15 to 0.8.16

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

labels.name: rust
labels.description: Pull requests that update Rust code

body:
Bumps [serde_yaml](https://github.com/dtolnay/serde-yaml) from 0.8.15 to 0.8.16.
Release notes

Sourced from serde_yaml's releases.

0.8.16

  • Add a Serializer and Deserializer type (#185, #186)

    let mut buffer = Vec::new();
let mut ser = serde_yaml::Serializer::new(&mut buffer);

    let mut object = BTreeMap::new();
object.insert("k", 107);
object.serialize(&mut ser)?;
    

    let de = serde_yaml::Deserializer::from_slice(&buffer);
let value = Value::deserialize(de)?;
println!("{:?}", value);

  • Support multi-doc serialization (#187)

    let mut buffer = Vec::new();
let mut ser = serde_yaml::Serializer::new(&mut buffer);

    let mut object = BTreeMap::new();
object.insert("k", 107);
object.serialize(&mut ser)?;
    

    object.insert("j", 106);
object.serialize(&mut ser)?;
    

    assert_eq!(buffer, b"---\nk: 107\n...\n---\nj: 106\nk: 107\n");

  • Support multi-doc deserialization (#189)

    let input = "---\nk: 107\n...\n---\nj: 106\n";

    for document in serde_yaml::Deserializer::from_str(input) {
let value = Value::deserialize(document)?;
println!("{:?}", value);
}

Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it.
